page.title: 20MINING..TRADE
page.content:
The demise of the mining industry in the Kelty area has had a disastrous effect on trade, especially the Cooperative Society. The Cooperative provided a large range of services. These included joiners, painting and decorating, plumbing, bakery productions, tailors, a small abattoir, hairdressing, stables, a large garage for accomodation and repairs, a large, very busy Office Building, a cobblers and shoe shop. There was also a large hall for various functions and activities. Today there is only a handful of Cooperative Shops left in the village
.
